dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 2393 : Country of Origin Labeling Amendments Act of 2015
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES
form.official-title: To amend the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 to repeal country of origin labeling requirements with respect to beef, pork, and chicken, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Country of Origin Labeling Amendments Act of 2015.

section.header: Repeal of country of origin labeling requirements for beef, pork, and chicken

subsection.text: Section 281 of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 1638) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), (8), and (9) as paragraphs (1), (2), (3), (4), (5), (6), and (7), respectively; and

subparagraph.text: by striking clause (i) and inserting the following new clause:

clause.text: muscle cuts of lamb and venison;

subparagraph.text: by striking clause (ii) and inserting the following new clause:
by redesignating clauses (ix), (x), and (xi) as clauses (viii), (ix), and (x), respectively.

subsection.text: Section 282 of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 1638a) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by striking beef, lamb, pork, chicken, and inserting lamb,;
by striking beef, lamb, pork, chicken, and inserting lamb, each place it appears in subparagraphs (A), (B), (C), and (D); and

clause.text: in the heading, by striking Ground beef, pork, lamb, chicken, and inserting Ground lamb,; and
by striking ground beef, ground pork, ground lamb, ground chicken, each place it appears and inserting ground lamb,; and

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (D) and (E) as subparagraphs (B) and (C), respectively.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives June 10, 2015.
